description: man wearing black, white and blue kimono with a sword lifted over his head; man is leaning against a screen painted with a hawk on a branch
inscription:
(Shigemori was a sword master of the Shintō school. He joined the 47 ronins with his son Tadaemon. Although he was fifty-some years old, he fought valiantly. During the fight, he\'d mistaken Moronō\'s san Moroyasu as his father. While he was going to kill the son, he heard the whistle signaling that Moronō was killed by somebody else. As soon as he heard the news, he rushed to the gathering place. Thus he missed the chance to kill Moroyasu.)

{Shigemori wa Shintō ryū kenjutsu no tatsujin nari. Shisoku Tadaemon to tomoni bōkun no kataki Moronō wo utan to meiyaku no gishi ni resshi, Ōboshi no shiki ni shitagai tekitei ni uchi iri, gojū yo sao to iedomo sōnen no mono ni mo otorazu, teitai hataraki wo shi, Moronō no soku Uhyōe Moroyasu wo teki to michigae, sude ni utan to machi keru ni, sono toki aizu no yobuko no fue ni, sono mama kashiko ni hase yuki shi ni, Yazama Takeyabu ra kataki wo uchi shi to kikoe shira ba, Moroyasu wo ba uchi morashi nu. Gishi ra wa yorokobi no mayu wo hiraki kachidoki wo age, Yahē Magodaiyū mondori shite yashiki wo shizuka ni hikitori keru.}
